myopenmath.statement:
A movie theater company wants to see if there is a difference in the variance of movie ticket sales in San Antonio and Oklahoma City per week. They sample 17 sales from San Antonio (group 1) and 20 sales from Oklahoma City (group 2) and count the number of tickets sold over a week. Test the claim using a significance level of \displaystyle\alpha =0.10. Assume that movie sales are normally distributed.
San AntonioOklahoma City

Based on the hypotheses, compute the following:
Round answers to at least 4 decimal places.
The test statistic is =
The left tail critical value is =
The right-tail critical value is =
The decision is to
Reject the null hypothesis
Accept the alternative hypothesis
Fail to reject the null hypothesis
Reject the claim
.
The correct summary would be:
There is not enough evidence to reject the claim
There is not enough evidence to support the claim
There is enough evidence to reject the claim
There is enough evidence to support the claim
that there is a difference in the variance of movie ticket sales in San Antonio and Oklahoma City per week.

ul.li: D: There is enough evidence to support the claim
